data.title: ExoPriors: Accounting for observational bias of transiting exoplanets
data.name: ExoPriors
data.description: Calculate log-likelihood penalties to account for observational bias in exoplanet detection.

evidence: "ExoPriors is a Python code that accounts for observational bias ... by calculating a log-likelihood penalty for an input set of transit parameters." (indicates a scientific analysis tool used within research workflows)

"In order to calculate the appropriate log-likelihood penalty ... call the function: transit_LL_penalty(...)" (shows it is used as a callable function, i.e., a library/dependency rather than a standalone app)
README provides only usage of a Python function and no mention of package managers, binaries, or releases, implying distribution via the source repository.
